Detailed Description

Client interface for root file system access.

Class RootFileSystem enables unified file access to the file systems of the different storage devices available to the mobile station. A file is specified by a storage device Id and a pathname. Method RootFileSystem::GetFile() returns a FilePtr which is a smart-pointer wrapping a File object. File can be considered kind of a file handle and can be used e.g. to create, open, read, write, delete, or rename a file ( see class File).

The following sample function shows how to work with a file, in this case the flash storage device is used:

    static BOOLEAN MyFirstFileWrite()
    {
        const WCHAR text[] = L"My first text I write to a file...";

        Pathname pathname("/my_file.txt");

        // Get the "file handle".
        FilePtr file = RootFileSystem::GetFile(pathname, L"ffs");
        if (!file.IsValid()) {
            // Handle out of memory error.
            return FALSE;
        }

        if (file->Exists()) {
            if (!file->Open(File::ReadAndWriteMode)) {
                // Handle file open error.
                return FALSE;
            }
        }
        else {
            if (!file->Create(sizeof(text))) {
                // Handle file create error.
                return FALSE;
            }
        }

        // Use the file.
        if (!file->Write(text, 0, sizeof(text))) {
            // Handle file write error.
            return FALSE;
        }

        // If we don't explicitly close the file, it is done automatically on
        // destruction.
        return TRUE;
    }

All available storage devices are supposed to be registered with the RootFileSystem. In order to access a registered storage device call RootFileSystem::GetStorageDevice().

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
MAX_STORAGE_DEVICE_ID_LENGTH  A storage device Id string is limited to MAX_STORAGE_DEVICE_ID_LENGTH characters including the terminating 0 character, i.e. there may be at most MAX_STORAGE_DEVICE_ID_LENGTH - 1 significant characters in the storage device Id string.

Member Function Documentation

FilePtr RootFileSystem::CreateTempFile (  const Path &  base_path,
UINT32  size
)  [static]
 

See also:
CreateTempFile(const WString &, const Pathname &, UINT32)

FilePtr RootFileSystem::CreateTempFile (  const Pathname &  base_pathname,
UINT32  size,
const WString &  device_Id = L"rfs"
)  [static]
 

Returns a smart-pointer wrapping a new temporary File object which is fully created and ready for use. First it is tried to create the file with pathname base_pathname. If this is not successful as many internally defined extensions as necessary to create it successfully are added to the name immediately in front of the file extension. This procedure ensures that the Mime type of the file remains the same as specified by the extension of base_path. If no extension is specified the internally defined extensions are simply appended and the Mime type remains undefined. The temporary file is a file as any other file with the single exception that the physically allocated file is deleted automatically on destruction. If you want to convert a temporary file to a permanent one, invoke method File::MakePermanent() on it.

Parameters:
base_pathname The base pathname.
size The initial filesize in bytes.
device_Id The Id of the storage device default initialized to the root storage device.
Returns:
A FilePtr wrapping either a new temporary File object or 0 if the file could not be created.
See also:
File::MakePermanent()

BOOLEAN RootFileSystem::Exists (  const Path &  path  )  [static]

BOOLEAN RootFileSystem::Exists (  const Pathname &  pathname,
const WString &  device_Id = L"rfs"
)  [static]
 

Tells if pathname on storage device specified by device_Id exists. If it exists it may either be a file or a directory.

Parameters:
pathname The pathname to check for existence.
device_Id The Id of the storage device default initialized to the root storage device.

DirectoryIteratorPtr RootFileSystem::GetDirectoryIterator (  const Path &  filepath,
const FileFilterPtr &  filter
)  [static]
 

See also:
GetDirectoryIterator(const Pathname &, const FileFilterPtr &, const WString &)

DirectoryIteratorPtr RootFileSystem::GetDirectoryIterator (  const Pathname &  dir_pathname,
const FileFilterPtr &  filter,
const WString &  device_Id = L"rfs"
)  [static]
 

Creates a new iterator for directory dir_pathname on storage device with storage device Id device_Id and returns it wrapped into a smart-pointer. On success, the returned iterator loops over files and directories contained in directory dir_pathname. The files and directories listed are filtered using the passed filter functor. To iterate all files and directories just pass the empty file filter functor FileFilterPtr(0).

Elements of subdirectories are not iterated by the returned iterator. In order to iterate elements of subdirectories iterators for these subdirectories have to be created recursively.

If the directory dir_pathname to be iterated does not exist or is not a directory then the returned smart-pointer just wraps the 0 pointer.

Parameters:
dir_pathname The pathname of the directory whose files and subdirectories are to be iterated by the created iterator.
filter A filter functor (FileFilterPtr(0) for unfiltered access) to be used by the created iterator.
device_Id The Id of the storage device (default initialized to the root storage device) where directory dir_pathname is located.
Returns:
A DirectoryIteratorPtr wrapping either a new iterator object or 0 if there is not enough memory left.

FilePtr RootFileSystem::GetFile (  const Path &  path  )  [static]
 

See also:
GetFile(const Pathname &, const WString &)

FilePtr RootFileSystem::GetFile (  const Pathname &  pathname,
const WString &  device_Id = L"rfs"
)  [static]
 

Returns a smart-pointer wrapping a new File object. This file object can be considered kind of a file handle.

Parameters:
pathname The pathname of the file.
device_Id The Id of the storage device default initialized to the root storage device.
Returns:
A FilePtr wrapping either a new File object or 0 if the storage device device_Id does not exist or there is not enough memory left.

StorageDevicePtr RootFileSystem::GetStorageDevice (  const WString &  device_Id  )  [static]
 

Returns the storage device for the specified device Id. If such a storage device does currently not exist then the 0 smart-pointer is returned.

Parameters:
device_Id The Id of the storage device.

static UINT RootFileSystem::GetStorageDeviceCount (   )  [inline, static]
 

Returns the actual number of storage devices registered.

StorageDeviceIteratorPtr RootFileSystem::GetStorageDeviceIterator (  const StorageDeviceFilterPtr &  filter  )  [static]
 

Creates a new storage device iterator. The storage device iterator iterates over all storage devices which are currently registered to the root file system.

BOOLEAN RootFileSystem::IsDirectory (  const Path &  path  )  [static]

const WString &  device_Id = L"rfs"
)  [static]
 

Tells if pathname on storage device specified by device_Id locates a directory.

Parameters:

device_Id The Id of the storage device default initialized to the root storage device.

BOOLEAN RootFileSystem::MoveFile (  const Path &  from_file_path,
const Path &  to_path
)  [static]
 

See also:
MoveFile(const Pathname &, const Pathname &, const WString &, const WString &)

BOOLEAN RootFileSystem::MoveFile (  const Pathname &  from_file_pathname,
const Pathname &  to_pathname,
const WString &  from_device_Id = L"rfs",
const WString &  to_device_Id = L"rfs"
)  [static]
 

Moves the file at from_file_pathname on storage device from_device_Id to pathname to_pathname on storage device to_device_Id. Pathname to_pathname specifies an existing directory either with or without a filename. If a filename is not specified then the name of the source file is used as destination filename. If the destination file already exists the method fails. If pathname to_pathname specifies this file nothing is done and TRUE is returned.

Parameters:
from_file_pathname The pathname of the source file.
to_pathname The pathname where to copy the source file to.
from_device_Id Specifies the storage device of the source file.
to_device_Id Specifies the storage device where to copy the source file to.
Returns:
Flag indicating success.

void RootFileSystem::NotifyMediaAvailableStatus (  const StorageDevice &  device,
BOOLEAN  media_present
)  [static, protected]
 

Notifies the root file system about the media availability status of the storage device specified by argument device. Argument media_present specifies whether a media is inserted in storage device device. The root file system reacts to this by posting an RfsMediaAvailableStatusMsg to the system. Applications can register for this message and use it to display storage device icons and the like.

Parameters:
device The storage device for which the status is reported.
media_present The flag specifying whether a media is inserted or not.

BOOLEAN RootFileSystem::RegisterStorageDevice (  StorageDevicePtr  device  )  [static, protected]
 

Registers the specified storage device with the root file system. If another device with storage device Id string of the passed device has already been registered then the passed device can't be registered and FALSE is returned, since storage devices are identified by their distinct storage device Id string. If registering succeeded then TRUE is returned, if for any reason like out of memory the device can't be registered then FALSE is returned. A subclass of class StorageDevice should provide a public static method Setup() which registers a singleton instance of the storage device with the root file system on its first invocation.

Parameters:
device The device to be registered.
Returns:
Tells if the device has been successfully registered.

BOOLEAN RootFileSystem::UnregisterStorageDevice (  StorageDevicePtr  device  )  [static, protected]
 

Unregisters the specified storage device from the root file system and returns the success of unregistering. A subclass of class StorageDevice should unregister itself on destruction.

Parameters:
device The device to be unregistered.
